column1: 142kph, good length and in at off stump. No movement. Watchfully defended from the crease
back of a length on middle and off, tapped into the leg side off the back foot
length and angled across off stump, dropped into the point region with soft hands. Got right behind that
back of a length on leg stump, shuffles to try and glance. Pings off his thigh guard and lands in front of Vijay at short leg
hit on the thigh guard again as he goes on the back foot. Extra bounce on this length ball from an off stump line. Misses on the flick again
good length on off stump, climbs into his body again and he can't get bat on it
back of a length and wide outside off. Some shape away. This dies on the keeper as he leaves
short and wide again, slight shape away. Left alone. Better carry this time
short and wide outside off, doesn't come on as he looks to cut. Under-edge into the off side
back of a length at off stump, defended solidly into the covers
good length and swung away from the corridor, left alone
back of a length and straight through in the corridor, left alone

inside edge as Elgar hangs the bat nervously outside off. It's a length ball angled across off and he's rooted to the crease. Looks like he's expecting it to come in. Angled bat, closed face. It's runs past the stumps
good length and angling into the corridor. Left alone
good length and speared down leg. Shuffles to try and get power on this flick, but he can't connect. Parthiv leaps to his left and stops one-handed
good length in the corridor. Taps it into the leg side off the inside half and steals a single
143kph, full on leg stump, leans in and clips this through the open midwicket region
back of a length in the corridor. Nice line. Elgar scrambles to get on top of the bounce and defend off the outside half
good length and shaping away marginally outside off. Markram shuffles to cover the off stump and leaves
under-edge as he looks to cut. It was short and wide, shaping way. Fizzes towards Kohli at second slip
crunched. Back of a length and swinging away. Gets on top of it nicely and punches firmly through the covers
good length at off stump, shuffles sufficiently to get behind this. Puts in a half-stride across the stumps and punches elegantly, wide of mid-on
back of a length at middle stump, tapped to mid-on
good length and wide outside off, swinging away. Left alone
outside edge falls short of third slip. Elgar still anxious against that corridor line. Back of a length and rising a touch as he looks to defend. Plays with soft hands to survive in the end
good length and angled across the corridor, left alone
good length outside off, tapped on the up to mid-off
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, leaves it alone
short and rising in the corridor. Thinks about defending this, withdraws late and leaves
back of a length in the corridor, defended solidly on the back foot
back of a length outside off, slight shape in the air, nothing off the pitch. Left alone and Parthiv takes it in front of his face
good length at off stump, defended on the back foot
short and wide, swinging away from outside off. Left alone
short and just outside off, punched to deep point's right
good length and shaping away from off stump, awkwardly pushed, one-handed, to mid-off
length ball, angling across into a tight line outside off, left alone
a touch too straight, tucked off the pads to long leg
full, fourth-stump line, clipped to mid-on
fullish, angling into off stump, shows the full face to block it back to Bumrah
back of a length, fairly wide, left alone, and it only carries through at knee height

back of a length, and this time he gets it to nip back in a long way to accentuate his inward angle from wide of the crease. Sneaks between the airborne Markram's bat and body as he tries to hurriedly jam down in defence. Parthiv dives left to take it
good length right away, brings Elgar forward to defend in front of off stump. Straightened slightly into him as well
oh, excellent. This one nips away slightly after pitching on almost the same spot as the previous ball. Elgar comes half-forward to defend and it slides past his outside edge
back of a length close to off stump. Elgar waits and dabs it gently to the left of backward point
back of a length, sixth-stump line, left alone

length ball angling into middle stump, looking for lbw. Clipped to straight midwicket. I think they've quickly sussed out his tendency to clip balls from off stump or thereabouts just wide of mid-on, and placed a fielder there
back of a length, nips in off the pitch but starts just about wide enough for Markram to leave it alone
back of a length in the corridor, gets on his toes and opens his bat face to steer it just wide of a diving Rohit at gully. Gets his fingertips to it to slow it down
back of a length, angling into off stump. Gets into an uncomfortable position, half-forward, and squeezes it out to gully
back of a length, angling into the body, tucked to square leg
length ball, a tiny bit of away movement from a fifth-stump line. Big stride forward before leaving it
length ball angling in from wide of the crease, defended back to the bowler
length ball, a bit wider, left alone

shortish, a bit of extra bounce as Elgar goes back and across to defend in front of off stump. Takes his bottom hand off the handle but only after the ball gives it a painful smack. Keeps it down, though, in the direction of square leg

ohhh, this is beautiful bowling. He's pushed him back with that lifter, and now he bowls one fuller, slants it away into a fifth-stump line, and Elgar isn't quick enough getting forward to defend. Feels for it and it zips past his outside edge
length ball straightening towards middle and leg, worked away to the left of square leg. Went off the inside half of the bat
excellent length again, angling across to top of off. Elgar is half-forward, not really stepping forward as much as crouching forward, and blocks it back to the bowler

length ball slanting away into the fourth-stump corridor. Elgar is undecided between playing and leaving. Makes the decision to leave a little late, and he leaves his gloves in the way. Bounces down to the off side of the stumps and then up to the keeper
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
and Markram completes the picture with a gorgeous drive, helped by mid-off's misfield. It was overpitched and wide outside off
good length on off stump, nips back in a touch as he hangs the bat out in front of the body. Dribbles wide of fine leg off his inside edge
overpitched again and lots of width. Half-stride to meet it at the pitch and then he caresses it past mid-off
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length and late swing into the pads. Stands tall and gets the bat in front of the pad quickly. Flicks it wide of midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, dabbed to midwicket off the back foot
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
outside edge doesn't carry to third slip. Ishant's bowling from the end that Shami started from. It's slower from here. Back of a length outside off, he defends inside the line
good length and angled in at leg stump, tapped wide of  mid-on
outside edge still won't carry. This time to gully's right. Good length in the corridor, stabs at it and gets an edge
full and just outside off, left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length in at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length, angled in at the corridor. Leaves it alone...and then it hoops away from Parthiv, to his right. Does well to stop it
back of a length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
short and in the corridor. Defended into the gully region
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the covers
nearly plays on but this rolls past leg stump. Back of a length ball in the corridor. Soft hands and nervous attempted as he looks to defend
back of a length across off stump, left alone
good length in the corridor, watchfully tapped into the covers on the front foot
bouncer is too short and too far down leg side, Elgar leaves
back of a length and slight shape away, drops it into the covers with soft hands and steals a single
good length and in at off stump, defended off the back foot
full and on leg stump. Can't get bat as he looks to flick. Huge appeal from Pandya as he thuds the front pad, that was neither pitching in line, nor hitting
good length in the corridor, defended down the pitch
back of a length across the corridor, left alone
back of a length and rising sharply in the corridor, left alone
short and angled across off stump, left alone
overpitched outside leg stump, nervous push as he reaches out for it. Leading edge into the covers
good length and in the corridor, defended on the back foot
beats the outside edge as Markram offers the face inside the line of this in-dipper. Deviates away slightly. Classic Ishant
fuller and in at off stump. Taps it to mid-on's right and calls early and confidently
good length and wide outside off, left alone
swing. Away from Elgar from around the wicket. Swings a log way from a length outside off. Draws him in for a big drive and beats the outside edge
full and wide outside off, left alone
short and very wide, slight shape away too. Left alone
good length, swinging away, wide outside off. Left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length, floating away wide outside off, left alone
good length and outside off. Some late swing away, but too wide to make him play
overpitched and swinging away. Wants to drive and decides against it very late. Leaves
good length and swinging away outside off, defended into the covers on the front foot
good length and in at middle stump. Looks to poke it into the midwicket area to get a single. Not allowed
back of a length and shaping away outside off. Tapped back down the pitch off the back foot
back of a length and shaping away outside off, left alone
back of a length, swinging away outside off. Left alone
good length and wide outside off. Left alone
full outside off stump, defended on the front foot
bouncer at middle stump, decides late to try and hook this. Bad decision. Beaten
good length at middle stump, flicks uppishly to deep square
full and just outside off. Half-stride from Elgar and he has to open the face late to try and control the drive. Slices it past point in the end
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended watchfully to mid-off
back of a length and bouncing in at middle stump. Pushed wide of short off the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
good length and floated down leg side, spins further. Left alone
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot. Lots of bounce again
back of a length at middle stump, pushed into the leg side
good length and down leg side, spins past the inside edge. Parthiv misses the gather
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the covers

deep square leg misjudges a top edge terribly and the ball floats over his head as he fishes for it like a boy in his first summer cricket camp. Bouncer gets big on Elgar and he top-edges the hook. Vijay runs in and has already done too much to recover and take this. Ten yards between him and the rope
length outside off, tapped to deep point
overpitched on middle stump, stands tall and drives imperiously, wide of mid-on with great timing
poor ball. Short and wide outside off, leaps off the ground to get on top of it and hammers it through the covers
back of a length in the corridor, gets on his toes and punches to mid-off
short on middle stump, nudged into the square leg area
good length on middle stump, defended on the back foot
tossed up nicely on a length outside off, left alone

good length, floated up wide outside off. It's climbing and turning as Elgar looks to drive on the up. Beaten. There's a stumping appeal that's send upstairs, but his back foot it back in. Very loose shot
back of a length in the corridor, pushed to cover off the back foot
good length and flat. Defended in front of off stump
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot
length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
overpitched outisde leg stump, Markram flicks aerially and powerfully. Well wide of deep square
back of a length outside off, pushed to mid-off from the back foot
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, gets on top of the bounce and nudges it through square leg
full at leg stump, reaches out with no feet and pokes it to short midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, gets deep in the crease and adjusts for the bounce as he dabs it past leg slip
back of a length at midlde stump, poked to square leg off the back foot

review for caught behind. Kohli is the most animated on during the appeal. Ashwin less so, Parthiv undecided. Elgar was pushing on the front foot outside off as this one bounced past the outside edge...replays show there is no edge. Review lost.
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on middle stump, steps out and just manages to get bat on this as it spins into him. Pokes it past short leg
full on leg stump, squeezed to fine leg with a flick
good length on middle stump, defended from the crease to midwicket
full on middle stump, plonks the front leg across and drives to mid-on
overpitched outside off, waits for it to get into his zone and drives it past the bowler. Beats mid-off's dive to the right
whack after he pushes onto the back foot very quickly. It's a short ball outside off, he gets under it and pummels it to the midwicket boundary on the bounce
short ball down leg side, controls the hook as he swivels, gets it down to fine leg along the turf and brings up his fifty
full outside off stump, defended on the front foot
loopy full one on middle stump, plays well ahead of this body as he looks to punch it on the full. Gets it to short midwicket off the toe-end
good length and bouncing into him. Deflected between short leg and leg slip off his thigh
full outside off, defended on the front foot
back of a length and turning into middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
slider outside off on a good length. Well picked in the end. Leaves it
good length and pushed across the left-hander. Defended towards the slips with soft hands off the outside half
good length and angled across off stump, left alone
shot! Oh stunning from Elgar. Third slip's come in for the edge he gets for deliveries in this line. This time he gets on the back foot, closes the face and punches it wide of mid-on
good length and in the corridor. Pushes it into the covers with soft hands and gets to the other end
nearly chops it on as he goes on the back foot and looks to defend. Didn't get behind the line of that. Angled bat outside off as it nipped back in
back of a length in the corridor, behind it this time as he pokes for a single at point
good length and up outside off, defended on the front foot
full and makes it dip at on off stump line, defended into the leg side
back of a length at off stump, goes on the back foot and squeezes it into the off side as it spins into him
flat and short of a length on middle, watches it come in and pokes it past leg slip off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
lovely shot. Skips down the track, meets it on the pitch at off stump and lofts it straight over the bowler
uff, scorching back foot punch but deep point is there. Ishant starts short and wide outside off
good length and in the corridor, defended into the covers
good length, slanted across the corridor. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, taps it to mid-on with a closed face
outside edge lands short of second slip. Kohli dives to his left to stop it. He was in close with a helmet on before lunch. That would've been out if he had stayed there
back of a length at off stump, tapped through midwicket off the back foot
good length and flat at off stump. Squeezes it out to cover with a mistimed drive
back of a length and rising up in the corridor. Gets on the back foot and taps into the off side

and he hangs on to a deflection off his stomach! A bizzare shot, but it was coming from Elgar. Ashwin was making him dance, really. He steps out, premeditatedly. It's back of a length from Ashwin so he's never going to reach the pitch of it. Forced to drive on the up. Hits it aerially into a jumping Vijay's mid-riff. It gets jammed there fractionally, between body and right elbow. He reacts quickly to juggle and hold on. That might have even carried to short extra if silly point wasn't there
good length and bouncing up as Amla leans in for the defence. Pings him high on the bat and drops in front of short leg
full and spinning down leg, left alone
good length, flight, loop, turn, bounce. Amla gets caught on the pad as he looks to defend and it lobs up for a diving short leg
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length at middle stump, flicked straight to short midwicket
good length and slight shape in at off stump, very late. Reverse? Can't tell. Defended solidly on the front foot
good length and in at the corridor again. Defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, drops it into the off side with soft hands and steals a single despite the direct hit from a tumbling Kohli
short ball angled at his chest, he gets beside the line and lets it pass down leg side
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
full and dipping at middle stump, drills the flick past midwicket. Can't beat deep midwicket's slide to the left
good length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
length on middle stump, carefully pushed to short leg
back of a length on middle, defended off the back foot
inside edge onto pad and it lands well in front of short midwicket. Amla not to the pitch as this dips viciously on him. He was looking to flick
overpitched and into the pads. Brings the bat down quickly and tickles it fine
good length and in the corridor, defended on the front foot
good length in the corridor, nudged into the off side off the back foot
good length at middle stump, tapped to midwicket's right
full and swinging in towards off stump. Blocks solidly on the front foot
full and swung in towards middle stump. Amla gets in a dangerous position, locked in front of off. Just manages to get the bat down and keep it out
good length at off stump, defended into the leg side
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at middle stump, flicked with soft hands. Can't get it past leg slip
back of a length in the corridor, chopped straight to point
full outside off, dead-batted into the pitch
good length and pushed through fast at off stump. Defended off the back foot
back of a length in at off stump, leaps to try and flick. Deflected wide of gully off the pad
back of a length and climbing in at Markram, who inside edges it onto back thigh as he leaps
short ball at the ribs, drops it towards fine leg off the back foot. Rohit Sharma slips as he throws, no one is backing up for a slip. It's an extra run through mid-off
bouncer too far down leg side, left alone
short at leg stump, clipped to fine leg
good length and into the pads. Flicks to deep square and gets a big roar from the crowd for his first run
drops it short outside off, gets deep in the crease and punches to the extra cover boundary
good length at middle stump, not to the pitch again as he flicks. Half-chips it to midwicket
good length at middle stump, pushed to fine leg
good length on middle stump, defended into the leg side
full at middle stump, flicks it through short leg
good length at middle stump, pushed on the front foot. Big inside edge flies between leg slip and short leg
back of a length in the corridor, gets on top of it and defends into the off side

overpitched on middle and leg. Stands tall and checks his drive. Once again, he was reaching out in front of the pad after locking himself with a shuffle. In the end, it's elegant, it's deft, it's past mid-on and it's four
short and wide outside off, slashes, misses
back of a length and angled into the corridor, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended with soft hands
tossed up on middle stump, defended into the leg side
tossed up on leg, picks it up on the full and swipes across the line to send this to the square leg boundary
good length on middle stump, defended to short leg
full on middle stump, driven straight to short midwicket
full at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length in the corridor, springs above the bounce and punches gloriously through the covers. Deep point cleans up to his right
short and wide outside off. Looks to play the upper cut, ends up chipping it past cover. Deep point has to sprint to his right again
short one at the ribs, swivels and mistimes the hook. Rolls out to backward square
miscues another hook and this one is off the toe and towards mid-on. Through the shot early as this lifts up at him on an off stump line
top edge on the hook and he gets four from above the keeper. No control at all from Markram over the last four ball. This is short and angled wide, across him
bouncer dropped too short, he leaves it alone
floated up at middle stump, steps out and is beaten in flight. Goes through with the shot and shovels it over mid-on, on the rise
good length at middle stump, dead-batted into the pitch
fingertips from Pandya at short midwicket, leaping to his left. Would've been a screamer. Amla struggling to get to the pitch. Gets closer this time, but his drive is aerial
full at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full and swinging in at middle stump, defended very close to the body, down the pitch
bouncer in the corridor, sways away from it
good length at off stump. Defends with such soft hands that he has to then accommodate by getting out of his pose and kicking the ball away as it rolls towards off stump
back of a length outside off, adjusts as the ball straightens and steers it past the solitary slip. It's four. Wow.
back of a length in the corridor, left alone as it rises
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, spinning in at middle stump. Defended into the leg side
drops it short outside off, skips onto the back foot and punches through the vacant cover region. Not letting the scoring opportunities go
back of a length at middle stump, deep in the crease, glanced to deep square
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up at middle stump, drilled to midwicket
arm ball outside off, pushed through flat. He's looking to set them up, coaxing them to drive through the covers with the one that drifts away. But Amla leaves
short and wide outside off, climbs on top of it and chops it into the turf, powerfully through point
good length in the corridor, defended into the covers
good length at middle stump, squeezed out to deep square off the back foot
short of a length wide outside off, left alone
good length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
good length and swinging away late outside off, left alone
good length on middle stump, defended into the leg side
short and wide outside off, quickly on the back foot and thumped in front of square on the off side. Beats both the fielders square on the off side
tossed up at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length at leg stump, closes the face too early. It comes off the back of the bat, past short leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
tossed up at middle stump, premeditated sweep. Hurriedly gets under it and manages to drag it out to midwicket
back of a length in the corridor, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length in the corridor, mistimes the drive on the up. Slices off the outer half to point
bouncer too short, doesn't attempt the hook
good length and late swing away outside off. He's looking to flick and has to adjust. Pokes feebly into the leg side
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length at off stump. Pushes to square leg off the back foot
back of a length, pushed through fast and skidding away from Amla who cuts very late and gets it through the covers
back of a length on off stump, waits for it to turn and nudges to backward square leg
full on middle stump, driven to midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, glanced to backward square
tossed up on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
overpitched on middle stump, glorious on-drive straight to the fielder
back of a length outside off, punched on the up to deep point's right
good length and shaping away outside off, left alone
good length and in at middle stump, dead-batted into the leg side
good length at middle stump, solidly blocked into the off side
good length at off stump, big inside edge onto pad as he looks to whip across the line
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, defended on the front foot

gets him straight away! Has he? Markram reviews. It's a late cut, that looks very much like an edge. Everyone behind the bat is excited, as is Ashwin. Oh he's reviewed because he's connected with the back pad as he plays the shot. But he has connected with the ball at the same time. This will remain out. His affair with the 90s must be a painful one. Top class innings ends tamely. It was a back of a length ball in the corridor and he was looking to play the late cut
good length, flat at middle stump. Defended on the front foot
tossed up on off, shows all his stumps as he drives it to midwicket
short and wide. 'Come on Aaaassshhhh!' Kohli screams from slip as AB duly slaps it through the covers
full and down leg side. Can't get bat as he looks to flick
good length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket on the up
full and in at leg stump, flicked to short midwicket
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full inswinger at leg stump, but Amla does well to get the bat in front of his pad. Then, he drives past midwicket
good length and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, slices to deep point
tossed up at off stump, defended into the leg side
back of a length at leg stump, dabbed to deep square off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot

oh you genius. Doesn't get to the pitch of this length ball on middle stump. But those wrists. Whew. Flicks forcefully and smothers the bounce completely. All fielders inside the circle on the leg side, he has no problem piercing them
length on middle stump, tapped to deep midwicket
good length, slight reverse into the batsman. Too wide. Left alone

is that a drop from Parthiv? Seems like it. A diving chance down leg. Length ball on leg stump, looks to flick and gets a thin edge. Parthiv isn't in position to catch that. It's a stop in the end with a last ditch dive
good length wide outside off, left alone
length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket on the up
good length at leg stump, clipped to deep square
back of a length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
full and flat outside off, pulls out the reverse sweep and gets it wide of sleep. Deep point has no chance
full at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
full at off stump, driven to mid-off's right
good length at leg stump, flicked to short fine
good length, pushed through on middle stump. Defended on the back foot
full on middle stump, pushed to midwicket
good length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
good length and in at the pad. Can't get the flick away. It trickles down leg side off his pad
back of a length outside off, tapped down the pitch off the under-edge
good length and in at middle stump, tapped on the up to midwicket
back of a length and in at off stump. Defended off the back foot
good length at leg stump, flicked to fine leg
shortish, lots of width, just taps it on top of its head and sends it rolling towards deep point
full, looking for the yorker maybe, keeps his front leg out of the way and defends towards point
length ball wide of off, a bit of outswing. Too wide to interest Amla
length ball close to off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length on off stump, jabbed back to the bowler. A tiny hint of inward reverse
shortish outside off, punched to deep point
back of a length at off stump, tapped to extra cover off the back foot
back of a length in at the corridor. Inside edge into the pitch as he looks to punch on the up
good length and in at middle stump, flicked to deep square
bounces past the off stump after an inside edge. Length ball outside off, stabs at it with no feet. Skidding low, that one
good length on off stump, tapped back to the bowler on the up
good length outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
full and down leg side, flicked to fine leg
good length and in at the pads. Stays put in the crease and tickles it deftly. Fine leg has no chance to his right
slower ball at a length outside off. Driven uppishly towards mid-off. Deceived him
back of a length outside off, tapped through point
back of a length and down leg side, glanced to fine leg
bouncer dug in too short, floats into Parthiv's gloves as AB leaves
short and wide outside off, stands tall, slashes through point. No one deep on the off side. Expect that to change...
good length and in the corridor, defended into the off side
back of a length in the corridor, shovelled into the covers on the up
good length and in at middle stump, defended into the leg side
good length on off, tapped down the pitch
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up outside off, defended on the front foot
length on middle stump, pushed behind square off the front foot
back of a length at off stump, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
tossed up at leg stump, pushed into the leg side
full and dipping on leg stump. AB beaten by flight. Squeezes the flick past square leg off the inside edge
length ball, flat outside off. Blocked on the front foot
thick outside edge to gully as he pushes on the front foot. Length ball holds its line outside off
back of a length at off stump, tucked to deep square from the crease
good length and slanting in from outside off. Left alone
146kph, back of a length in the corridor, straightens again outside off. But it's an old ball and he has time to adjust and steer this between slip and gully
good length, wide outside off. Left alone
good length and in at off stump. Inside edge into the leg side as he defends on the front foot
full on off stump, defended down the pitch
tossed up at off stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length on middle stump, drops into the pitch of the leading edge as he closes the face early
length on middle, defended from the crease
tossed up on middle, blocked on the front foot
full on leg stump, dead-batted to short leg
full on middle stump, driven to mid-on
good length and climbing up at the thigh. Cops it on that front leg as he looks to flick
back of a length and angled in at off stump. Defended into the leg side off the inside half
back of a length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket off the back foot

nearly knocks the off stump out with a full toss! Whew. 144kph full toss, about knee height, drifts away in the corridor as AB looks to punch it through the leg side. Hits Parthiv in the chest. That was awkward for everyone
full at off stump, driven back firmly down he pitch. Bumrah stops with an outstretched leg in his follow through
tossed up outside off, skips down and drives it past the non-striker. Beats mid-off's dive to the right
length on middle, defended on the back foot
full at off stump, watches it drift away and nudges it through cover. That's the fifty partnership
length on leg stump, tapped to midwicket

length outside off, smothered off the inside edge

length ball on middle and leg, goes back to turn it quietly to backward square leg

down the track but can't reach the pitch. Clips quietly towards midwicket

back of a length on middle and strikes him on the pad in front middle as he looks to shuffle and flick. Appeal turned down and they won't review. That might have climbed over the stumps

direct hit at the non-striker's end as Pandya swivels and pulls off a sensational throw. It's been sent upstairs and it looks out. Stunning, stunning work from Pandya. Short ball at middle stump. Gets on top of the bounce and drops it into the short leg region. Pandya sprints along with Faf, but he knows which way he wants to go. Swivels on his toes as he picks up, and it's a rocket throw, crashing into the middle of the stumps at the other end. Amla does some course correction as he sprints. He's at least a yard out. Pandya picks up and takes two steps and is aerial as he unleashes the throw. Whew
good length wide outside off, pokes at it and runs it past slip off the outside edge

gets him first ball! India are back in this! Length ball, dipping outside off. QDK wafts at it with no feet, following the ball only with his hands. It's lazy. And quite unlike Kohli at slip, who reacts quickly to grab to his left. That flew quickly to him
length and pushed through flat at middle stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
length on middle, defended off the back foot
tossed up full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
flicks aerially to short leg who was on the move and copped this on the knee. Tossed up generously from Ashwin again

back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length on middle stump, defended into the leg side
good length and slanted across off stump, left alone

Philander has had a brain fade. This is poor from South Africa. A back of a length ball swinging down leg side. He looks to flick and gets a leading edge that lands between keeper and the incoming midwicket fielder. As that lobbing ball is in the air, Philander is wandering down the pitch, whilst looking at it. On first appearance, so is Faf. But he is lifting his hand up and screaming no. Philander doesn't look at him, he can't hear him either. Throw comes to Pandya and flicks the bails off

dropped! That was Rahane territory. Excellent follow-up ball, quicker, on off stump, and he's stuck on the crease and opened up in defence. Thick edge, flies quickly to the right of Kohli at slip, and he dives, gets a hand to it, but can't hold on. Looks like it hit the edge of Parthiv's left glove before reaching Kohli

another drop! Down the track now, Ashwin dangles it up and gets it to dip on him. Nowhere near the pitch, goes for the big hit anyway, and he skews the ball high over the off side. Short third man (Shami) and point (Pandya) converge under it. The ball gets into Pandya's hands, but he's distracted by Shami running across him, and the ball falls to ground
comes forward to defend in front of middle stump, gets an inside-edge onto pad
quicker and flatter, du Plessis jams his bat down to defend from the crease, into the square-leg region
back of a length, angling across towards off stump. Defends without too much footwork, gets a thick edge that rolls down towards third man
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
ooh, beauty. Tight line on off stump, just short of a length, and it nips away off the pitch to beat Faf's back-foot defensive
back of a length, a bit of width this time. Faf stands tall and punches it away to the cover point boundary. No one in the wide spaces between short extra-cover and deep backward point
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended to short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, this one comes on a little slower. Waits for it and uses his wrists to work it away to deep square leg
goes back to a length ball turning towards leg stump, uses his wrists to keep it down in front of leg gully
floated up wide of off stump, and Faf gets down low and brings that bottom wrist into play for a hard sweep between the deep midwicket and deep backward square leg fielders

quicker length ball on middle stump, comes forward and plays it to short leg with a turn of his wrists
some flight this time, on leg stump. Steps out and clips to deep backward square leg

back of a length, goes with the angle - may have been the arm ball - and slides down the leg side as Rabada goes on the back foot and misses the flick. May have been aiming for the pads and missed his line slightly
length ball angling into middle stump, worked away to deep square leg

edged, and it doesn't carry to first slip. Length ball in the corridor, Rabada is a little slow getting forward and across to defend. Hangs his bat out and the ball drops well short of Pujara at first slip, and then it bounces away into the gap to his right. Should Parthiv have dived across?
back of a length close to off stump, jabbed away into the point region
full, angling into off stump. May have just left him off the pitch there. Wanted to drive through mid-off, I think. Thick outside edge runs away to the left of the diving Rohit at point
length ball close to off stump, presses forward and blocks into the off side
goes back to a length ball turning from middle to off, defends into the on side
lovely flight and dip just outside off, then sharp turn to beat the outside edge as he comes forward to defend
quicker, a bit shorter, no turn, goes back to work it through square leg
flat again, angling into middle and leg, goes back to defend to midwicket
fuller now, a bit more flight on middle and off, defended to silly point
beats him again. Loops this up outside off, nice and full, inviting the cover drive. Goes for it but it dips and rips past his outside edge

back of a length on off stump, goes deep in his crease to work that away through backward square leg and pick up two more

carrom ball. Spins away. But it's short and wide and he slices it past point with ease

good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length in the corridor, pushed into the covers with an open face

clean bowled. Inswinger speared in on middle stump. He wants to whip this wide of mid-on with power, but there's a big gap between bat and pad. Misses by a long way in the end
beaten on the inside edge. Length ball angled into the corridor. Looks to punch

tossed up outside off, drives again. Can't get it past silly point
inside edge fizzes past short leg as he pushes on the front foot. Length ball on off stump, hard hands as he defends. That was close

he's run out first ball! That's what third umpire will confirm anyway. Pujara dabs the full ball to mid-on, looks to steal the single and Ngidi's throw hits the non-strikers stumps on the bounce. He's miles out, even with a dive.
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
shot. Nice looking off drive, straight to mid-off. Full from Rabada

good length outside off, big stride forward to push it to cover's left. Markram swoops down on it and flicks an underarm throw at the striker's stumps in the same motion as his dive. Vijay had made it
good length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
beaten on the outside edge as he goes back to a good length ball in the corridor. Big appeal from QDK, nothing from most others
oh what a bouncer. Zooms in at his chest and he does superbly to drop the wrists and let this go
nicely timed. Reaches out to this length ball outside off and taps it nicely through the covers. No flourish, soft hands. Full balance. Expertly done
full on off stump, full face to drive it past the non-striker and beat mid-on
good length on middle stump, shuffles and clips to fine leg
full and just outside off, left alone
full on middle stump, tapped to mid-on from the crease
good length and just outside off, left alone
full and just outside off, defended on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, gets on top of the bounce and steers it past gully. Maharaj gives chase from cover point but can't cut it off
lovely shot. Length on off stump, shuffles and clips it to deep square
back of a length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
draws him forward outside off and gets it to climb, left alone
played. On top of the bounce again on middle stump as he dabs it to deep square
138kph, back of a length in the corridor. Defended off the back foot
138kph, bouncer in the corridor. Kohli sways away
back of a length at off stump, flicked straight to square leg
length on off stump, shuffles and clips straight to square leg
138kph, good length and just outside off. Defended on the front foot
length ball lifting up in the corridor. Surprises Kohli but he's behind it and defends off the high part of the bat
good length in the corridor, defended from the crease
back of a length in the corridor, tapped to extra cover
back of a length on off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length and straightening in the corridor, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
floated up outside off, Vijay finally goes after one and holds his balance nicely. Caresses it through the covers
good length and in the corridor, defended off the back foot
nearly traps him in front of middle stump as Kohli plonks his front leg across to try and flick this from off. Inside edge onto pad
back of a length at off stump, gets on top of it and taps it wide of mid-on. Calls for three immediately. Gets it
back of a length outside off, left alone
full in the corridor, defended into the leg side
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
outside off, left alone
good length in the corridor, defended solidly
Kohli jab! Beaten. Chases and loses balance as he pushes outside off on the front foot. Rabada has words for him
bouncer on middle stump, ducks under it
full outside off, leans in and flicks it past midwicket. Not fully in control but he's got enough bat to tease Morkel and eventually beat him
good length at off stump, flicked to mid-on's right
141kph, good length outside off, driven on the up to cover's left
145kph, full and nips in very close to the off stump. Left alone on the front foot
141kph, back of a length in the corridor, left alone. Dies on the keeper
142kph, good length outside off, left alone
143kph, outside edge lands short of AB as he dives to his right at gully. Back of a length outside off, slices it
full outside off, defended on the front foot. Very close to the pad as it jags inwards, but he had got it outside the line
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
144kph, length outside off, big stride to defend on the front foot
good length, wide outside off, left alone
good length wide outside off, left alone
back of a length on middle stump, leaps and nudges to long leg
good length, wide outside off. Left alone
lbw appeal as Kohli shuffles and misses a flick. That was going above. Pitched on a length and climbed up at middle and off
142kph, full outside off. Gets the flick off the inside edge as he loses balance
overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off
short and wide outside off, cut to deep point
back of a length in the corridor, big inside edge as he looks to defend on the back foot. Rolls wide of the keeper on the leg side
143kph, length and in at off stump. Defended late from the crease
chases wide outside off, but he's on top of it with the front foot stride. Drives it past cover
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
bouncer very short outside off, left alone
good length in the corridor, defended solidly on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
good length and shaping away from the corridor, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
good length, shaping in to the corridor. Left alone
full and wobbling in the corridor, pushed to mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, punched to deep point
inside edge as he looks to defend on the back foot in the corridor. Gets two to long leg's right
good length, wide outside off, left alone
short and wide outside off, left alone
good length on off stump, defended on the back foot
good length in the corridor, defended
wanted to pull out of this square drive. Went through with it. Full ball outside off, chased and checked. Ran it aerially to deep point
good length and wide outside off, left alone
full and swinging away from off stump, looks for the cover drive. Inside edge into the midwicket region
good length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
short of a length in the corridor, climbs at him and he adjusts very late to get on top of this and cut through gully
good length outside off, driven on the up to cover

traps him in front of off stump and the appeal is turned down. Shuffles and gets caught in two minds about where to hit this. It skids on from a length. Landed on the seam though, and it was going over
full outside off, shuffles and flicks to midwicket
starts with a full toss again. Driven to deep mid-off
full and drifted into middle stump. Pushed to midwicket
full on leg stump, flicked to mid-on's right
tossed up on off stump, driven to mid-off
floated up on off stump, driven back to the bowler
full on off, driven to mid-off, with a slight deflection from short extra cover's dive to the right
good length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
good length in the corridor, squeezed off the inside edge to midwicket as this dips in late
full on off stump, squeezed into the midwicket region off the inside edge
good length and in at off stump, defended very late, very close to the body
good length and moving away late. Anxious form Vijay as he leaves. They've curbed his shuffle and push forward by getting QDK up
back of a length in the corridor, punched to short midwicket off the back foot
full and drifted into the legs. Driven to mid-on
overpitched on off, driven firmly with the turn but can't beat short extra's dive to the left
short and wide outside off, waits for it and hammers to the point boundary. Fifty for the third wicket
full on middle stump, defended on the front foot
good length, dipping outside off, spinning away a touch. Makes him reach out for the defence
full on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length and slanting in towards off. Defended very late from the crease
good length and wobbling at an off stump, deep in the crease to defend
good length on middle stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length and nipping away off the surface in the corridor, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, left alone
full and drifted in at leg stump, jabbed wide of mid-on
tossed up at off stump, driven to sweeper cover
back of a length on middle stump, whipped to short fine
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
full at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length at off stump, punched to cover off the back foot
what a shot. Full outswinger outside off stump but Vijay uses his wrists to drill this through midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
good length outside off, reaches out and stabs it in front of deep point
full on middle stump, late shape away. Pushed to mid-on
overpitched outside off, opens the face to push it to deep point
overpitched outside off, holds his balance and punches this past the non-striker
full on leg stump, leans in and clips it between midwicket and mid-on
arm ball, in the corridor. Backs away, exposes his stumps and slices to point
back of a length, turning and bouncing away. Pushes away from the body to point
short and wide outside off, late cut, straight to point
good length on off, defended on the front foot
full and drifted in at middle stump, driven to mid-on
overpithched just outside off, driven back to the bowler
full outside off, leans into the cover drive and manages to beat extra cover. Sweeper cleans up
back of a length, wide outside off. Left alone
good length outside off, walks down the track and defends on the front foot
length outside off, defended into the leg side
short and wide outside off, mistimes a cut to deep point
full outside off, driven to deep mid-off
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
climbs past the outside edge as he gets leg side to try and cut. That spun and bounced above his shot. Very close
tossed up on off stump, driven to short extra
good length, wide outside off, left alone
overpitched outside off, driven to sweeper cover
bouncer fired down leg side, left alone
bouncer dug in too short, ducks under it
bouncer at the ribs, dabs it square off the glove
short ball at middle stump, climbs on top and spanks it. Straight to deep square
gets under the bouncer to leave
back of a length on middle, clipped to square leg
back of a length in the corridor, makes room and chops from close to the body. Can't beat point
good shot. Full at leg stump stump, plants the front leg forward and brings the bat down sweetly on this sweep to find the square leg boundary
tossed up on off stump, driven to short extra cover
floated up on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
arm ball nearly sneaks through. Vijay goes on the back foot and just keeps it out as it heads for off stump
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
short ball sits up for him and he pulls in front of square to bring up his fifty
ducks under this short one
ducks under another one, this one down leg side
and again. Avoids going after this leg stump bouncer
bouncer across off stump, ducked
short ball on leg stump, dabbed to leg gully as he leaps
tossed up on off stump, driven to short extra-cover
back of a length now, on off stump, goes back and defends back down the pitch
lovely ball, dips onto a good length and goes on with the angle. Times his front-foot stride well, ensures his pad isn't in the way, and defends into the off side
not short enough or wide enough to cut, goes back and chops into the backward point region

gone! This was coming - he's been trying to cut him repeatedly for the last three-four overs, even when the ball wasn't short enough. Tries it again - this one's got some width on it but it isn't a short ball - and it hurries through and gets a top edge through to de Kock
flat and fired in full on middle and leg, gets his front pad out of the way to defend towards silly point

ooh, and he bowls a beaut first up. Back of a length, away seam in the corridor, extra bounce. Kohli jabs away from his body - much like the first innings in Cape Town - but this time he doesn't edge it
a bit fuller and a bit wider. Kohli takes a big stride forward and leaves it
shortish rising ball in the corridor, left alone
fuller now, in that sixth-stump corridor. Kohli leaves again. How long will he keep doing this?
ooh, excellent follow-up ball. Full, angling into the stumps, looking for lbw. Kohli plays around his front pad but does so safely on this occasion to pick up a flicked single to deep square leg
back of a length, fairly wide of off, left alone
tossed up full on off stump, big stride forward to drive inside-out to the man at deep point
full flighted ball on off stump, blocked to short extra-cover
nice flight again, some drift in towards middle stump, blocked back to the bowler, keeping the front pad out of the way
nice length, not as full as the previous two balls, angling into off stump. Defended into the covers
short, wide, and Rohit puts that away easy, a nice late-cut to get off the mark, to the left of backward point. This is the sort of ball Vijay should have waited for
lots of turn, but it turns from a good length well wide of off stump, and Rohit makes no attempt to play
length ball wide of off stump - seventh or eighth stump, and if you actually measured it might be the 14th stump - and Kohli leaves it alone
short outside off, gets up above shoulder height, and Kohli plays a tennis-style swat-pull to the right of the diving Morkel at mid-on
stylish leave from Rohit. Fullish, on a tempting fifth-stump line, and he watches it until the last moment before lifting his bat away with a swishing motion
goes wider this time, gets some away movement. Rohit leaves again
good ball, on a length and shaping away from a sixth-stump line. Looks like reverse outswing. Rohit watches it well and leaves it
full, much closer to off stump, defended to short extra-cover
nice footwork there, skips out to the flighted off-stump ball and drives inside-out to the right of short extra-cover. Long-off moves left to stop it
beautiful. Some drift in towards middle and leg and dips slightly on Rohit, who defends inside-out to short extra, with his bat reaching just a touch away from his body
a bit quicker along the same line, defended to short extra-cover
flat and full now, on middle and off, defended back down the pitch
a teaser bowled wide of off stump, not short enough to cut. Rohit leaves it
tossed up nicely on middle stump, stretches out and defends it back to the bowler
full outside off, driven to short extra-cover
length ball wide of off, moved his line back to that 7th or 8th stump. Kohli shuffles across and plays an open-faced dab towards gully
bouncer, well bowled. Comes into the batsman, who is taking a step out of his crease and across his stumps (as usual), and he has to hurriedly duck it

big appeal for lbw, catches Kohli on the shuffle with one that nips in from just back of a length. Not-out is the call, not reviewed either. Jagged in and he tried to bring his bat down hurriedly to push into the on side. Both feet were off the ground when the ball hit his front pad, and he may have shuffled outside the line of off stump too. Umpire's call on impact, missing the top of the stumps, according to ball-tracking
length ball outside off, carries through at head height to de Kock after Kohli leaves
length ball, fourth-stump line. Nice stride forward for a push to deep point
flighted and full close to off stump, stretches out to defend into the covers
again, flighted ball on off stump, driven to the deeper, squarer cover
flatter now, on off stump, opens his bat face to dab towards backward point. Wants the quick single, Rohit sends him back
back of a length outside off, goes nice and deep in his crease, waits, and simply taps the ball on top of its head to guide it wide of slip and down into the third man region
fullish, drifting in towards off stump, defends inside-out into the point region
fullish on middle stump, defended to short extra-cover
full outside off, driven wristily to mid-off

length ball, sixth-stump line, strides out and drives to the right of deep point. Maharaj throws to the bowler's end, and nearly catches Rohit short - he was a little slow running the second. Direct hit, he was gone by yards!
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the point region
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and tucks it to deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length, a bit of away swing in the corridor, Rohit ignores it
full and drifted into the pads. Inside edge as he looks to flick
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off's left
full on off stump, defended into the covers
skidder in the corridor. Goes deep in the crease and cuts hurriedly to point
good length and in on middle stump, defended on the front foot
classy from Rohit. Steps out as this comes in full on leg stump. Reaches the pitch and whips it over mid-on, one bounce and four
good length outside off, defended into the covers
good length and wide outside off. Chases and drives aerially to deep point
good length in the corridor, left alone
bouncer at middle stump. Comes on too quickly as he looks to hook. Dribbles past midwicket and deep square cleans up to his left

struck on the back leg right in front of off stump. This nipped back in and beat the inside edge. They've reviewed after the umpire gives this...it's hit him on the back thigh. Feet are quite deep in the crease. There's no bat on it...tracker shows it's umpire's call as it clips the top of middle. He's gone. Slanted in at a length by Rabada, Rohit looking to drive on the up and is caught playing the wrong line. 7th lbw dismissal in his 42 Test innings, to go with nine times being bowled
back of a length and wide outside off, left alone
floated full on middle stump, pushed to midwicket
tossed up on middle stump, driven to long-on
drifted full outside off, driven nervously on the up, without getting to the pitch
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, taps it cover's left and steals the single
bouncer at off stump, ducks under it
good length and wide outside off, jabs to deep point
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length and straightens away from off stump, defended to point off the outside edge
good length and moving away outside off, left alone
yorker headed for middle stump is dug out very very late
full on middle stump, stretched forward and pushes to long-on
full outside off, mistimed drive to short extra cover
back of a length, spinning in sharply from the rough. It's headed for middle and off. He just manages to get bat as he attempts to cut while falling into the leg side
length on off stump, steps out and drives to long-on
short and wide, cut to sweeper
good length outside off, defended on the front foot

struck on the pad as Kohli shuffles across to the off side and looks to flick. It's a full ball and he's struck in front of off. Did he manage to get outside the line? Was there bat? We'll see as SA have reviewed...oh it's plumb but UltraEdge says there's bat! So so close. Full and dipping in. They picked up two as it rolled through square leg, and then an extra run as an overthrow to sweeper
good length and down leg side. Looks to flick, beaten
148kph, back of a length on leg stump, flicked to fine leg's right
back of a length on leg stump, nudged to fine leg
beats the outside edge! Ngidi is getting as close as he can to getting Kohli as his first wicket. Length ball bouncing high outside off. Kohli chases far away from his body
inside edge as he jabs in the corridor. Back of a length ball nips back in at him. Single behind square on the leg side
full on middle stump, leans in and drives to long-on
length and in the rough outside off. Whips on the rise to deep midwicket
good length outside off, bounces up from the rough as he pushes forward to defend
tossed up on off stump, driven back towards the bowler
good length at off stump, flicked to short midwicket
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length in the corridor, pushed to deep point
good length on leg stump, tapped to square leg on the up
short and very wide outside off, chases it and misses
bouncer flies past his shoulder. He's lucky that fizzes so quickly. It's saved him from getting an edge. Not in position to hook at all
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, nipping away off the surface and past the outside edge as he hangs the bat out
length and into the rough. Pings off the pad as he looks to flick
back of a length and spinning in sharply at off stump. Chops it into the off side
thick outside edge as he stretches too far forward to try and drive this away-drifted outside off. Plays behind his body. Ngidi's chase from short third man is lazy at best
full outside off, pushed back to the bowler
good length at off stump, pushes forward and flicks to midwicket
nicely played. Doesn't get to the pitch but uses the full swing to get behind this outside off and lift it over midwicket with the turn
full on off stump, flicked to deep square
classy. Leans into the overpitched ball outside off and creams it through the covers
good length and shaping away outside off, left alone

his maiden wicket is a beauty! Angles in to off stump, nips away off the surface and draws the edge as Parthiv looks to defend his stumps. Offered the full face and that's about all he could have done. Big outside edge and Ngidi is overjoyed
short and wide outside off, left alone
outside edge as this ball dies on him. Nips away sharply too. Lands well short of slip and squeezes behind him
good length and wide outside off, left alone
good length outside off, dies on the keeper as Pandya leaves this
141kph, good length and wide outside off, left alone

wow! Short ball outside off, he walks into the off side ad fetches it with a boisterous pull shot to the midwicket boundary. South Africa had a 2 minute discussion about that short ball. Pandya was more simple...
back of a length wide outside off, walks at it and leaves
full outside off, defended into the covers
good length in the corridor, defended into the covers
good length, wide outside off. Walks at him too. Left alone
good length outside off, walks into it and defends
full and wide outside off, left alone
yep, yorker in at off stump. Pandya up to it. Stays put this time and drives firmly past Kohli, but Markram stretches a long way to save that at mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length and wide outside off, left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
past the outside edge as this nips away off the surface. Defending away from the body
good length and wide outside off, late movement away. Left alone
full outside off, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
good length and in at off stump. Shuffles and punches on the up to mid-on
walks into the off side again. Leaves the short ball alone
overpitched outside off, walks at it, leaves
under-edge as the short ball keeps low. Once again, walking into the off side and looking to drag it with a pull. Lands short of De Kock
good length and in at middle stump, stands tall and drives past the non-striker
bouncer very short outside off, and very wide too. Walks at it and leaves. It's called wide
good length wide outside off, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, stabbed through midwicket off the back foot
bouncer flies past his shoulder as he leaves
bouncer on middle stump, ducks under it
nearly chips one to square leg. Morkel goes cross seam and full at leg stump. Pandya's head falls over intot he off side as he flicks and he gets this to square leg on the bounce
short on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length and shaping away outside off, pushed to sweeper on the front foot
good length outside off, left alone
good length and in at middle stump, pokes it through midwicket off the front foot
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
outside edge goes wide of first slip. Kohli hurriedly jabs outside off on the front foot. There was reverse, coming into him. He played inside the line
good length outside off, left alone
good length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, walks into it and taps it into the covers. Kohli refuses the single
back of a length outside off, left alone
bouncer at leg stump, gets on top of the bounce and dabs it behind square on the leg side off the glove
big offcutter, coming into the corridor from back of a length. Left alone
short and wide outside off, left alone
good morning. Full and wide down the leg side, too much for De Kock, and that's an expensive loosener
good length outside off, pokes at it and is beaten
full and swinging sharply into the pads. Flicked to fine leg
back of a length outside off, nips back in off the pitch. Left alone
good length outside off, big stride to defend on the front foot
good length in the corridor, rises up on him as he pushes on the front foot. Gets it into the pitch off the inside half of the bat
good length and swinging away outside off. Walks across, leaves
back of a length outside off, slight movement away off the pitch. Shuffles to get behind this and defend into the off side
good length outside off, late movement away. Shuffles and defends to mid-off
full and wide outside off, left alone
yorker in the corridor, hurriedly jammed to mid-on
good length wide outside off, driven to sweeper cover with an open face
big inswinger at off stump, manages to get the bat in front of the pad and push this to mid-on
another inswinger, on a length at off stump. Defended to mid-on
good length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off, tapped to deep backward point
good length and tailing in at off stump, defended solidly on the front foot
138kph, straightening off the surface in the corridor. Thick outside edge as Kohli jabs at it. Flies past gully's left hand

glorious. Classy front foot drive through the covers, executed to perfection. Big stride, soft hands, slightly away from the body but right off the middle of the bat as this swings away late. Creams it between short cover and extra cover
outside edge falls safely in front of Amla at first slip. Back of a length and straightening in the corridor. Stabs away from the body again
good length on off stump, defended from the crease
full outside off, driven to extra cover

135kph, full on middle stump, drilled past the non-striker. Elgar gives chase from mid-off and pulls it back. Takes the boundary padding with him as he slides. The ball rolls past the line where the padding was. Interesting to see if they'll check that...they won't.
back of a length in the corridor, defended down the pitch
length on middle stump, taps it wide of mid-on
142kph, back of a length outside off, lifts and moves away in the corridor. Left alone
good length and wide outside off, left alone
142kph, back of a length in the corridor, walks towards it and drops it into the open point region
good length and fizzing in at off stump. Gets it onto pad off the inside edge as he looks to keep this out. Steals the single pitchside

celebrates the hundred as soon as he gets to the non-striker's end, then awkwardly sprints back with bat and helmet in hand as there's an overthrow to be had. This is a length ball, coming into him. He taps it into the midwicket region with soft hands and lets out a characteristically furious celebration
length on leg stump, looks to flick, deflected off the pad. QDK leaps big to his left and holds on
full and wide outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length outside off, left alone
good length in the corridor, holds its line as he jabs away from the body. Thick outside edge through gully. Deep point cleans up to his left

good length and late swing away in the corridor. Defended to mid-on who Pandya wants to take on. Kohli says no. Pandya has to run back and looks like he's in as Philander hits direct...but his leg's in the air! Oh they're amused to have stolen a run as the ball deflects into the leg side, but he doesn't look so smart now. Terrible from Pandya. He's made his ground - well he would have, but he wasn't on the ground. The bat and foot are in the air as ball hits stumps.
nasty bouncer greets Ashwin. Fizzes past his grille and he barely has time to react
another one. This one headed for his left collarbone.  Awkwardly fends. Very late. He's beaten.
143kph, and for the second time in the series, South Africa have found Ashwin's thumb with a short one. This climbs at his chest and once again he's caught fending.
outside edge flies over gully. Very nervous waft outside off as another short one angles in at him. But this one moves away as well as it climbs.
good length at middle stump, pushed to Philander's right at mid-on and they get the singe
short ball outside off, gets his bat well inside the line and leaves
short ball in the corridor, angled in this time. Bat inside the line again as he leaves
short ball wide outside off, wafts at it away from the body, beaten
short and wide outside off, chases and slices. In control this time. Boundary through backward point
good length in the corridor, defended to backward point
big inswinger at middle stump, flicked to mid-on's right
good length in the corridor, nipping away from him. Squared up as he pushes into the covers
good length and slight shape away outside off. Plants the front leg forward and carves it through cover on the up
pummels it wide of mid-off. In the air for a bit but wide of extra cover. Length ball outside off and he punches on the up, away from his body. Assertive
superb assault from Ashwin. Good length and wide outside off, drives through the line and on the up, sends it to the cover boundary again
short ball just outside off, withdraws the bat this time
good length and swinging away outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, Kohli sashays out of his crease and defends into the covers
lovely ball, in the corridor, jags away off the seam. Kohli does well to leave it
length ball on middle and off. Kohli shuffles across to tuck it into the square leg region
full outside off, defended to short extra-cover
back of a length, fifth-stump line, defended to short extra cover. This one seemed to keep slightly low and not really come on to the bat
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face and steers it to that newly stationed third man
lovely. Extra bounce from a good length in the corridor, and Ashwin's outside edge is beaten as he presses forward to defend
back of a length, a little wider. Shapes to play, and then pulls his bat away from the line as it veers away late
length ball angling into middle and off, stays in the crease and defends to short extra
back of a length close to off stump, defended to short extra-cover

back of a length close to off stump, a bit of extra bounce, and South Africa appeal for a catch at gully. Ashwin gets out in that area a lot, and this was a hard-hands jab, the ball just flew off the outside half of the bat. Soft signal is not-out... AB dived to his left from gully and took it low - did it bounce before it reached him? good length and fired in from wide of the crease. Straightens as he looks to defend the angle on the back foot. Squeezes into the off side off the outside half
good length at off stump, keeps very low as he looks to defend
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right but can't beat his dive
good length and wide outside off, stabs and he's beaten

back of a length at off stump, pushed to point off the back foot
floated up on off, defended on the front foot
goes wide of the crease and pushes on flat. Doesn't straighten. Tapped to midwicket with the angle

back of a length ball spins away from off, beaten on the back foot
